raw_text: Before describing our approaches of applying deep syntactic information yielded by an HPSG parser for fine-grained rule extraction, we would like to briefly review what kinds of deep syntactic information have been employed for SMT.Two kinds of super tags, from Lexicalized Tree Adjoining Grammar and Combinatory CategorialGrammar (CCG), have been used as lexical syntactic descriptions (Hassan et al, 2007) for phrase based SMT (Koehn et al, 2007)
clean_text: Two kinds of supertags, from Lexicalized Tree Adjoining Grammar and Combinatory Categorial Grammar (CCG), have been used as lexical syntactic descriptions (Hassan et al, 2007) for phrase based SMT (Koehn et al, 2007).

raw_text: Birch et al (2007) and Hassan et al (2007) have shown the effectiveness of adding su per tags on the target side, and Avramidis and Koehn (2008) have focused on the source side ,translating a morphologically-poor language (English) to a morphologically-rich language (Greek)
clean_text: Birch et al (2007) and Hassan et al (2007) have shown the effectiveness of adding supertags on the target side, and Avramidis and Koehn (2008) have focused on the source side, translating a morphologically-poor language (English) to a morphologically-rich language (Greek).

raw_text: Hassan et al (2007) improve the statistical phrase based MT model by injecting super tags, lexical in formation such as the POS tag of the word and its sub categorization information, into the phrase table, resulting in generalized phrases with placeholders inthem
clean_text: Hassan et al (2007) improve the statistical phrase based MT model by injecting supertags, lexical information such as the POS tag of the word and its subcategorization information, into the phrase table, resulting in generalized phrases with placeholders in them.

raw_text: This analysis then lets us abstract and encode many local and some nonlocal syn tactic structures as complex tags (dynamically, as opposed to the static complex tags as proposed by Birch et al (2007) and Hassan et al (2007))
clean_text: This analysis then lets us abstract and encode many local and some nonlocal syntactic structures as complex tags (dynamically, as opposed to the static complex tags as proposed by Birch et al (2007) and Hassan et al (2007)).

raw_text: A similar approach based on su per tagging was proposed by Hassan et al (2007) .They used both CCG super tags and LTAG super tags in Arabic-to-English phrase-based translation and have reported about 6% relative improvement in BLEU scores
clean_text: A similar approach based on supertagging was proposed by Hassan et al (2007). They used both CCG supertags and LTAG supertags in Arabic-to-English phrase-based translation and have reported about 6% relative improvement in BLEU scores.
